SEARCH
Package civitas.celestis.math.complex

Class Quaternion

java.lang.Object
civitas.celestis.math.vector.Vector4
civitas.celestis.math.complex.Quaternion
All Implemented Interfaces:
Vector<Vector4>, Serializable
public class Quaternion extends Vector4
A complex number with three imaginary parts. Quaternions are often used to represent the rotation of three-dimensional vectors without suffering from gimbal lock.

While arithmetic operations share some similarities with those of four-dimensional vectors, quaternions have unique properties and operations that make them especially suitable for representing rotations and orientations in three-dimensional space.

See Also:
  • Vector4

      public static final Quaternion IDENTITY

    • multiply

      @Nonnull public Quaternion multiply(double s)
      Multiplies this quaternion by a scalar. This is not appropriate to use as a substitute for scale(double), as it changes the magnitude of this quaternion, no longer making it a rotation quaternion. (a quaternion with a Euclidean norm of 1)
      Specified by:
      multiply in interface Vector<Vector4>
      Overrides:
      multiply in class Vector4
      Parameters:
      s - The scalar to multiply this quaternion by
      Returns:
      The resulting quaternion
      See Also:
      • scale(double)

    • scale

      @Nonnull public Quaternion scale(double s)
      Scales the rotation of this quaternion. This will only work properly if this quaternion is a rotation quaternion. (a quaternion with a Euclidean norm of 1)
      Parameters:
      s - The scale factor to apply to the rotation
      Returns:
      The scaled quaternion

    • normalize

      @Nonnull public Quaternion normalize() throws ArithmeticException
      Normalizes this vector to have a Euclidean norm (magnitude) of 1. If this vector has no direction (the Euclidean norm is zero), this will throw an ArithmeticException, as normalization is not possible.
      Specified by:
      normalize in interface Vector<Vector4>
      Overrides:
      normalize in class Vector4
      Returns:
      The normalized vector of this vector
      Throws:
      ArithmeticException - When the Euclidean norm of this vector is zero
      See Also:
      • Vector.normalizeOrZero()
      • Vector.normalizeOrDefault(Vector)

    • normalizeOrZero

      @Nonnull public Quaternion normalizeOrZero()
      Normalizes this vector to have a Euclidean norm (magnitude) of 1. If this vector has no direction (the Euclidean norm is zero), this will return itself. (which is zero, since only zero vectors can have a magnitude of zero)
      Specified by:
      normalizeOrZero in interface Vector<Vector4>
      Overrides:
      normalizeOrZero in class Vector4
      Returns:
      The normalized vector of this vector if successful, a vector representing origin (zero) otherwise
      See Also:
      • Vector.normalize()
      • Vector.normalizeOrDefault(Vector)

    • normalizeOrDefault

      @Nonnull public Quaternion normalizeOrDefault(@Nonnull Vector4 v)
      Normalizes this vector to have a Euclidean norm (magnitude) of 1. If this vector has no direction (the Euclidean norm is zero), this will return the provided fallback value v instead of throwing an exception.
      Specified by:
      normalizeOrDefault in interface Vector<Vector4>
      Overrides:
      normalizeOrDefault in class Vector4
      Parameters:
      v - The fallback value to default to when normalization is impossible
      Returns:
      The normalized vector of this vector if successful, the fallback value otherwise
      See Also:
      • Vector.normalize()
      • Vector.normalizeOrZero()
